definition: to gather together/to investigate/to entangle/to correct
to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: But, because we are so complex, the three are all tied together.
sentences.chinese: 但是，因为我们如此复杂，这三个因素纠集在一起。

sentences.english: Jackson pleads with a yearning intensity he hadn't mustered in years.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊恳求强度与向往，他还没有在年纠集。

sentences.english: They packed the ballot with dummy candidates to split the vote.
sentences.chinese: 他们立假后选人纠集选票以分裂选票。

sentences.english: After many days you will be mustered .

definition: to cause trouble/to provoke a dispute
to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to roam all over the place/to go into every nook and corner/to infiltrate/(of criminals, enemies etc) to be on the run/to flee and try to hide
to cause trouble/to create a disturbance
to coordinate outside and inside offensives (idiom)/(fig.) to act together
